DC Comics.label: DC Comics
DC Comics.description: DC Comics, Inc. is one of the largest and most successful companies operating in the market for American comic books and related media. Wikipedia

Oni Press.label: Oni Press
Oni Press.description: Oni Press is an American independent comic book publisher based in Portland, Oregon. It was founded in 1997 by Bob Schreck and Joe Nozemack with the goal of publishing the kinds of comics and graphic novels they themselves would want to read. Wikipedia

Boosey & Hawkes.label: Boosey & Hawkes
Boosey & Hawkes.description: Boosey & Hawkes is a British music publisher purported to be the largest specialist classical music publisher in the world. Until 2003, it was also a major manufacturer of brass, string and woodwind musical instruments. Wikipedia

Copper Canyon Press.label: Copper Canyon Press
Copper Canyon Press.description: Copper Canyon Press is an independent, non-profit small press, specializing in the publication of poetry and located in Port Townsend, Washington. Since 1972, the Press has published poetry exclusively. Wikipedia

Encounter Books.label: Encounter Books
Encounter Books.description: Encounter Books is an American conservative book publisher. It is an activity of Encounter for Culture and Education, Inc. Wikipedia

Fiction Collective Two.label: Fiction Collective Two
Fiction Collective Two.description: Fiction Collective Two is an author-run, not-for-profit publisher of avant-garde, experimental fiction supported in part by the University of Utah, the University of Alabama, Central Michigan University, ... Wikipedia

George Bell & Sons.label: George Bell & Sons
George Bell & Sons.description: George Bell & Sons was a book publishing house located in London, United Kingdom, from 1839 to 1986. Wikipedia

Holt McDougal.label: Holt, Rinehart and Winston
Holt McDougal.description: Holt McDougal is an American publishing company, a division of Houghton Mifflin Harcourt, that specializes in textbooks for use in secondary schools. Holt, Rinehart & Winston was a division of Harcourt Education. Wikipedia

Reaktion Books.label: Reaktion Books
Reaktion Books.description: Reaktion Books is an independent book publisher based in Clerkenwell, London, England. Reaktion Books was founded in 1985 in Edinburgh, Scotland, and moved to London in 1987. Wikipedia

Deseret Book.label: Deseret Book
Deseret Book.description: Deseret Book is the largest Latter-day Saint book publisher and also owns a chain of LDS bookstores in the western United States. Over 150 people work in its Salt Lake City headquarters. Wikipedia

Wiley-Blackwell.label: Wiley-Blackwell
Wiley-Blackwell.description: Wiley-Blackwell is the international scientific, technical, medical, and scholarly publishing business of John Wiley & Sons. Wikipedia

Doubleday (publisher).label: Doubleday
Doubleday (publisher).description: Doubleday is an American publishing company. Wikipedia

Drawn and Quarterly.label: Drawn and Quarterly
Drawn and Quarterly.description: Drawn and Quarterly is a publishing company based in Montreal, Quebec, Canada, specializing in comics. It publishes primarily comic books, graphic novels and comic strip collections. Wikipedia

Harlequin Enterprises.label: Harlequin Enterprises
Harlequin Enterprises.description: Harlequin Enterprises Limited is a Toronto-based company that publishes series romance and women's fiction. Wikipedia

Bayard Presse.label: Bayard Presse
Bayard Presse.description: Bayard Presse was founded in Paris in 1870 and has since expanded into a global publishing network. Considered the e-map of France, their core publications market comes from the children's sector, and ... Wikipedia

Conran Octopus.label: Conran Octopus
Conran Octopus.description: Conran Octopus is a division of Octopus Publishing Group, a cross-platform illustrated book publisher. Including architecture, design and gardening. Wikipedia

Continuum International Publishing Group.label: Continuum International Publishing Group
Continuum International Publishing Group.description: Continuum International Publishing Group was an academic publisher of books with editorial offices in London and New York City. It was purchased by Nova Capital Management in 2005. In July 2011 it was taken over by Bloomsbury Publishing. Wikipedia

Dell Publishing.label: Dell Publishing
Dell Publishing.description: Dell Publishing, an American publisher of books, magazines and comic books, was founded in 1921 by George T. Delacorte, Jr. with $10,000, two employees and one magazine title, I Confess, and soon began ... Wikipedia

Feldheim Publishers.label: Feldheim Publishers
Feldheim Publishers.description: Feldheim Publishers is an American Orthodox Jewish publisher of Torah books and literature. Its extensive catalog of titles includes books on Jewish law, Torah, Talmud, Jewish lifestyle, Shabbat and ... Wikipedia

IPC Media.label: IPC Media
IPC Media.description: IPC Media Ltd, a wholly owned subsidiary of Time Inc., is a consumer magazine and digital publisher in the United Kingdom, with a large portfolio selling over 350 million copies each year. Wikipedia

Ki-oon.label: Ki-oon
Ki-oon.description: Ki-oon is a French manga publisher founded in October 2003 by Cécile Pournin and Ahmed Agne. It's mostly dedicated to releasing heroic fantasy. It released its first manga in March 2004, the first volume of Element Line. Wikipedia

Northwestern University Press.label: Northwestern University Press
Northwestern University Press.description: Northwestern University Press is the university press of Northwestern University in Evanston, Illinois, USA. Wikipedia

South End Press.label: South End Press
South End Press.description: South End Press is a non-profit book publisher run on a model of participatory economics. It was founded in 1977 by Michael Albert, Lydia Sargent, John Schall, Pat Walker, Juliet Schor, Mary Lea, Joe ... Wikipedia

Avon (publishers).label: Avon
Avon (publishers).description: Avon Publications was an American paperback book and comic book publisher. As of 2010, it is an imprint of HarperCollins, publishing primarily romance novels. Wikipedia

Prentice Hall.label: Prentice Hall
Prentice Hall.description: Prentice Hall is a major educational publisher owned by Pearson PLC. Prentice Hall publishes print and digital content for the 6–12 and higher-education market. Wikipedia

Alfred Music Publishing.label: Alfred Music
Alfred Music Publishing.description: Alfred Music is a family-owned and operated music publishing company. Founded in New York in 1922, it is headquartered in Van Nuys, Los Angeles, California, with additional branches in Miami, New York, ... Wikipedia

Amalgamated Press.label: Amalgamated Press
Amalgamated Press.description: The Amalgamated Press was a newspaper and magazine publishing company founded by journalist and entrepreneur Alfred Harmsworth in 1901, gathering his many publishing ventures together under one banner. Wikipedia

Bantam Books.label: Bantam Books
Bantam Books.description: Bantam Books is an American publishing house owned entirely by Random House, the German media corporation subsidiary of Bertelsmann; it is an imprint of the Random House Publishing Group. Wikipedia

Llewellyn Worldwide.label: Llewellyn Worldwide
Llewellyn Worldwide.description: Llewellyn Worldwide is a New Age publisher, currently based in Woodbury, Minnesota, a suburb of St. Paul. Wikipedia

McGill-Queen's University Press.label: McGill-Queen's University Press
McGill-Queen's University Press.description: The McGill-Queen's University Press is a joint venture between McGill University in Montreal, Quebec and Queen's University in Kingston, Ontario. Wikipedia

Naiad Press.label: Naiad Press
Naiad Press.description: Naiad Press was one of the first publishing companies dedicated to lesbian literature. At its closing it was the oldest and largest lesbian/feminist publisher in the world. Wikipedia

New Writers Press.label: New Writers Press
New Writers Press.description: New Writers' Press is an Irish small press that specialises in poetry publishing. The press was founded in 1967 by the poets Michael Smith and Trevor Joyce and Smith's wife Irene in response to what ... Wikipedia

Three Rivers Press.label: Three Rivers Press
Three Rivers Press.description: Three Rivers Press is the trade paperback imprint of the Crown Publishing Group, a division of Random House. It publishes original paperback titles as well as paperback reprints of books issued initially in hardcover by the other Crown imprints. Wikipedia

University of New Mexico Press.label: University of New Mexico Press
University of New Mexico Press.description: The University of New Mexico Press, founded in 1929, is a university press that is part of the University of New Mexico. Its administrative offices are in the Office of Research, on the campus of UNM in Albuquerque. Wikipedia

Victor Gollancz Ltd.label: Victor Gollancz Ltd
Victor Gollancz Ltd.description: Victor Gollancz Ltd was a major British book publishing house of the twentieth century. It was founded in 1927 by Victor Gollancz and specialised in the publication of high quality literature, nonfiction ... Wikipedia

Sterling Publishing.label: Sterling Publishing
Sterling Publishing.description: Sterling Publishing Company, Inc. is a publisher of nonfiction titles, with more than 5,000 books in print. Wikipedia

Carroll & Graf Publishers.label: Carroll & Graf
Carroll & Graf Publishers.description:
Carroll & Graf Publishers, an American publishing company centered in New York City, was an imprint of the Avalon Publishing Group,
Publisher Kent Carroll, the editorial director of Grove Press from ... Wikipedia

Garland Science.label: Garland Science
Garland Science.description: Garland Science is a publishing group that specializes in developing textbooks in a wide range of life sciences subjects, including cell and molecular biology, immunology, protein chemistry, genetics, and bioinformatics. Wikipedia

Sentinel (publisher).label: Sentinel
Sentinel (publisher).description: Sentinel was established in 2003 as a dedicated conservative imprint within Penguin Group. It publishes a wide variety of right-of-center books on subjects like politics, history, public policy, culture, religion and international relations. Wikipedia

Motivate Publishing.label: Motivate Publishing
Motivate Publishing.description: Motivate Publishing is a company based in Dubai and Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates. The company was established in 1979 by Ian Fairservice with the launch of What's On, the Gulf region's first English language magazine. Wikipedia

New York Review Books.label: New York Review Books
New York Review Books.description: New York Review Books is the publishing house of The New York Review of Books. Its imprints are New York Review Books Classics, New York Review Books Collections, The New York Review Children's Collection and NYRB Lit. Wikipedia

Apogee Books.label: Apogee Books
Apogee Books.description: Apogee Books is an imprint of Canadian publishing house Collector's Guide Publishing. The Apogee imprint began with "Apollo 8 The NASA Mission Reports" in November 1998 at the request of astronaut Buzz Aldrin, second man on the moon. Wikipedia

Vanguard Press.label: Vanguard Press
Vanguard Press.description: The Vanguard Press was a United States publishing house established with a $100,000 grant from the left wing American Fund for Public Service, better known as the Garland Fund. Wikipedia

Ashgate Publishing.label: Ashgate Publishing
Ashgate Publishing.description: Ashgate Publishing is an academic book and journal publisher based in Farnham, Surrey, United Kingdom. It was established in 1967 and specialises in the social sciences, arts, humanities and professional practice. Wikipedia

Profile Books.label: Profile Books
Profile Books.description: Profile Books is the name of a British independent book publishing firm founded in 1996. It publishes non-fiction subjects including history, biography, memoir, politics, current affairs, travel and popular science. Wikipedia

Ave Maria Press.label: Ave Maria Press
Ave Maria Press.description: Ave Maria Press is a Roman Catholic publishing company which was founded in 1865 by Father Edward Sorin, a Holy Cross priest who had founded the University of Notre Dame. Wikipedia

Gita Press.label: Gita Press
Gita Press.description: The Gita Press is world's largest publishers of Hindu religious texts. It is located in Gorakhpur city of India's Uttar Pradesh state. It was founded in 1923 by Jaya Dayal Goyandka for promoting the principles of Sanatana Dharma. Wikipedia

Universal Edition.label: Universal Edition
Universal Edition.description: Universal Edition is a classical music publishing firm. Founded in 1901 in Vienna, and originally intended to provide the core classical works and educational works to the Austrian market. Wikipedia

Time Inc..label: Time Inc.
Time Inc..description: Time Inc. is a subsidiary of the media conglomerate Time Warner, the company formed by the 1990 merger of the original Time Inc. and Warner Communications. It publishes 130 magazines, most notably its namesake, Time. Wikipedia
Time Inc..Founded: November 28, 1922, New York City, New York, United States

Dover Publications.label: Dover Publications
Dover Publications.description: Dover Publications, also known as Dover Books, is an American book publisher founded in 1941 by Hayward Cirker and his wife, Blanche. It primarily publishes reissues, books no longer published by their original publishers. Wikipedia

ArtScroll.label: ArtScroll
ArtScroll.description: ArtScroll is an imprint of translations, books and commentaries from an Orthodox Jewish perspective published by Mesorah Publications, Ltd., a publishing company based in Brooklyn, New York. Wikipedia

Baen Books.label: Baen Books
Baen Books.description: Baen Books is an American publishing company established in 1983 by science fiction publisher and editor Jim Baen. Wikipedia

Theodore Presser Company.label: Theodore Presser Company
Theodore Presser Company.description: The Theodore Presser Company is an American music publishing and distribution company located in King of Prussia, Pennsylvania and formerly based in Bryn Mawr, Pennsylvania. It is the oldest continuing music publisher in the United States. Wikipedia

Dial Press.label: The Dial Press
Dial Press.description:
The Dial Press was a publishing house founded in 1923 by Lincoln MacVeagh.
Dial Press shared a building with The Dial and Scofield Thayer worked with both. The first imprint was issued in 1924. Wikipedia

Lee & Low Books.label: Lee & Low Books
Lee & Low Books.description: Lee & Low Books is an independent children's book publisher focusing on diversity. Wikipedia

Macmillan Publishers.label: Macmillan Publishers
Macmillan Publishers.description: Macmillan Publishers Ltd, also known as The Macmillan Group, is a privately held international publishing company owned by Georg von Holtzbrinck Publishing Group. It has offices in 41 countries worldwide and operates in more than thirty others. Wikipedia

Island Press.label: Island Press
Island Press.description: Island Press is a nonprofit, environmental publisher based in Washington, D.C., that specializes in natural history, ecology, conservation, and the built environment. Established in 1984. Wikipedia

Kensington Books.label: Kensington Books
Kensington Books.description: Kensington Publishing Corp. is an American book publisher specializing in mass market paperback, trade paperback and hardcover books. It is the largest remaining independent US publisher of such books. Wikipedia

Rutgers University Press.label: Rutgers University Press
Rutgers University Press.description: Rutgers University Press is a nonprofit academic publishing house, operating in New Brunswick, New Jersey under the auspices of Rutgers University. Wikipedia

University of Arizona Press.label: University of Arizona Press
University of Arizona Press.description: The University of Arizona Press, a publishing house founded in 1959 as a department of the University of Arizona, is a nonprofit publisher of scholarly and regional books. Wikipedia

Wheatland Press.label: Wheatland Press
Wheatland Press.description: Wheatland Press is an independent book publisher, specializing in science fiction, fantasy, and horror short story and poetry collections. It was founded in 2002 by Deborah Layne. Wikipedia

Inner Traditions – Bear & Company.label: Inner Traditions – Bear & Company
Inner Traditions – Bear & Company.description: Inner Traditions – Bear & Company, also known as Inner Traditions, is a book publisher founded by Ehud Sperling in 1975 and based in Rochester, Vermont in the United States. Wikipedia
